'Wiley Rein LLP' is a Washington, D.C. law firm founded in 1983 under the name
Wiley, Johnson and Rein. In 1986, the firm, then known as 'Wiley & Rein', became
'Wiley Rein & Fielding' as Richard E. Wiley, former Chairman of the Federal
Communications Commission, and Bert W. Rein, former Deputy Assistant Secretary
of State for Economic and Business Affairs, were joined on the masthead by Fred
F. Fielding, former Counsel to President Ronald Reagan. With Mr. Fielding's
return to the White House as Counsel to President George W. Bush on February 1,
2007, the firm reverted to the name Wiley Rein LLP.

Wiley Rein LLP currently employs more than 270 lawyers in the firm's Washington,
D.C. and McLean, Virginia offices. Major practice groups include , government
contracts, insurance, international trade, government relations, food & drug
law, and general litigation.,
